A quote we love & live by.

With every transformation, first we must get to the root of the problem. Once we discover what that is, then we begin the process of letting go. Releasing the emotional baggage. The last thing to come off is the weight.
One thing I have learnt over the years, is that it’s never about the physical weight. One must be willing to do the work and dig deep, mentally, emotionally and spiritually.

Workout Wednesday!
Quad Kick Out:
Stand on one leg in the center of the wobble board. The other leg is bent and held at the knee. Kick the leg out directly in front of you, keeping it straight and parallel with a flexed foot.
Main muscles worked: quads, hamstrings, calves, glutes and core.
Reps: Two sets of 12 on each leg. “The aim of this exercise is to challenge your balance and stability. Try and keep upright and still,”

Fitness Friday! Prone Super Woman!
Working on our back is very important. As women we often avoid strengthening our back as we are too busy working on other body parts. Just as important as a strong abdominal wall, so is a strong upper and lower back. Both need to protect your spine.
Lay prone with your arms extended in front of you. Fire and engage your glutes as you lift both your legs and arms off the mat. Hold the contraction for a second and lower down.
Start with 8 reps.
Be sure to take a deep stretch in child’s pose after, as this prone superwoman is quite an intense exercise.

Workout Wednesday!
Let’s work those abductors!
Hip abduction works the glute med glute min and Tfl and really firms our booty 🍑
For those who sit all day for work, it’s important to keep your glute muscles strong, as sitting can make them weak.
I love adding my BBS circle band to add resistance and make it more challenging.
Be sure to work through hip abduction, pulling away from your midline without twisting your hips.
1. 32 reps on each side
2. 24 reps on each side
3. 32 reps on each side 🍑🍑😍

Workout Wednesday!
My version of (glute hamstring developer) and incline sit ups.
Both of these exercises are advanced and I wouldn’t suggest doing these on your own. Cross fit followers will most likely do these with their knees bent. As an ex dancer I like to challenge my body as I know my strengths.
Go at your own range of motion and have your workout buddy alongside you to check your form. Start with one rep and build up your strength.
You have to do it for YOURSELF first not anybody else. Note to self, make YOU proud. Chanting this Mantra today.

Fitness Friday!
Core strength and stability.
I am using my custom BBS gliding disc under both feet.
Start in plank position.
Muscles worked: transversus abdominis, glutes, external, and internal obliques, quads and hamstrings. Also you chest, shoulders and biceps.
Glide your leg through and underneath as you open up into side plank. Repeat 8 reps on each side.
Try and add grace and flow. 🤗

Monday motivation! Find a simple mantra to motivate you and keep you on track! Mine is "Say YES to life!" It opens the door of opportunity. What's yours? Share with us.

Bored of the static plank? Try this gliding disc exercise. I like to call it the windscreen wiper. Place the disc under your toe and swing the leg toward your shoulder at your own range of motion. Be sure to draw that navel towards your spine and keep your abdominals engaged. Start with 8 reps on each side and build up to 3 sets.

Workout Wednesday!
Bent over dumbbell row with 5 pounds.
Muscles: lats, rhomboids, rear delts, traps, and biceps.
Start with palms facing in, knees bent and body bent forward at the hips, while keeping your back straight until it is almost parallel to the floor. Drive your elbows back. Hold the contraction for a second and release to starting position. Alternate between single arm and both.
If you have back issues it is better to use lower weight for this exercise and be sure to concentrate on your form. It is important to strengthen the back. I know as women we avoid this work, however it’s essential to create strong muscles to protect our spine and work on our posture. 💪🏻

Amy has been with BBS for a year now!! We appreciate you xx Check out her story below 💕💕 -------------------
"It's been exactly one year since I started the BBS 8 week program. What a difference a year makes.
I am so grateful to Simone for not only creating a wonderful program but even more so a studio and environment that from the moment you walk in you feel welcomed.
I have always hated gyms. I love that at BBS it really feels like the one place in Los Angeles that no one judges you. Not only are the trainers warm and friendly but so is everyone that takes class. I feel so lucky to have found BBS.

A huge thank you to Erica, Michelle, Sharona, Nicole, Colin, Bridget, Dominique, all the new trainers and all the men and women who work at BBS. I love the workout but it's your energy, kindness and support that keeps me coming back.
I don't always make the right choices sometimes my love of Pizza, wine and chocolate is to overpowering but because of everyone at BBS & The 8 week program I know what those right choices are and continue to be motivated each and every day.
Just wait till May... 47 is not to late for rock hard abs. This is the year it happens for me... and I have high hopes to eventually not trip all over myself during that Burpee dance."

Simone and @aliceramshaw demonstrate the push up to side plank by adding the tramp as a progression. Place feet on the tramp. Lower your body down to the floor. Push up and twist into side plank. Lower back down to push up and repeat on the other side. Start with 10 reps and build!

Want to focus on your glutes and hamstrings? Simone shows your how with a move from our Hips Thighs and Buns class. Pick up a band to add resistance. Place it around the sole of your foot. Start in table top position. Kick back, foot flexed, leg parallel and extended, be sure to push against the resistance. Bring the knee back into chest. Start with 30 reps on each side. Make sure you don't lean into your hip or twist your upper body. @underarmourwomen

Fitness Friday!
Ball squat, ball squat to bicep curl, ball squat to frontal raise.
Muscles worked: quads, hamstrings, glutes, biceps, pecs, deltoids and core.
Grab a ball and 5-10 pound weights.
Lower your body down as your upper body is supported by the ball. Be sure to align knees over ankles. Don’t let your hips come lower than knee height. Stand and squeeze your glutes at the top of your range. Add a bicep curl your second set and then frontal raise on your third.
Start with three sets of 8 reps.

How to do a pike with a gliding disc. Swipe right! Start in the perfect plank. Place disc underneath the balls of your feet. Scoop your belly and contract your core as you lift your tail towards the ceiling. Slide your feet towards your wrists. Make sure to keep your legs straight and align your upper body. Lower the body down slowly back to plank and your starting position. Do 2 sets of 10 reps.

Simone's Full Body class today in NYC. Try these lower body exercises at home. If you don't have a gliding disc try a towel. Keep feet parallel and under your hips Slide the disc out to the side under your shoulders. Bend your knees into a deep squat. Feel the burn. Fire and activate your glutes, hamstrings and quads as you stand back up. Using your inner thigh squeeze and slide your foot back to your starting position. Repeat 10 times on each side!

Good morning! Trying to work up your appetite for Sunday brunch? Try these single leg hop exercises on an unstable environment like a bosu ball. Start with 3 sets of 10 on each leg. Be sure to land using the correct kinetic chain. Happy hopping! 😊

Fancy some Monday Motivation? Try this bosu stability exercise. Work on your core strength by alternating legs. For modifications land with both feet on the bosu ball. Start with 2 sets of 10 and build up from there.

Workout Wednesday! Leg series part 2. Using our custom BBS X @theraband CLX band. Set up: place the loop of the band around the sole of your foot and get into the perfect plank position. Main muscles worked: hamstrings, glute, core, chest and shoulders. Once in the plank position flex the foot and pull against the resistance as you raise your leg and lower down to the floor. Kick back directly behind you pushing against the resistance to fire your glutes. Be sure to not let your pelvis tilt, engage your abdominal wall and draw your navel to spine to keep your back flat. Keep your shoulders over your wrists and relax your neck. Do two sets of 8 reps on each side.

Trainer Life! It's very important to change out your shoes. If you exercise regularly you will need to replace your shoes every 3-6 months. New shoes protect your shins from high impact and also support your arches. At BBS we swear by @newtonrunning you can pick up a pair from our Brentwood location. Happy Dancing!

I am using my custom @theraband CLX band.
Frontal raise, lateral raise and oblique twist.
Main muscles worked: deltoids, pectorals, biceps, obliques.
Concentrate on lifting your arms to shoulder level and no higher. Slightly bend elbows and keep your shoulders down. Pull your navel towards your spine to protect your back. Move at a slower pace to focus on form.

Workout Wednesday! I am using our BBS circle resistance band. Set up in table top position. Place the band a few inches above your knee. Lift your knee in hip abduction for 8 reps and then pulse for 8. Do four sets and alternate every second set by taking your hand off to check your stabilization and core strength. Hip abduction works your glute max, med and minus along with your tfl. This hip strengthening exercise will even help you dance better! Come to class for some HIPS THIGHS & BUNS work.

Kick start your diet & workout regime with tip

Part 3 of my balance strength exercise. Grab a wobble board ( I am using @theraband) set up: stand on one leg extend the opposite arm and leg out. Draw them in towards your midline. Attempting to allow your knee and elbow to kiss 😘 then extend back out. Try and attempt 6 reps on each side. Main muscles worked, core, obliques, quads, hamstrings, calves. Good luck!

We love when clients share their personal journey with us. NYC beauty Victoria Balonik was suffering with chronic Lyme disease. She shares her story with us below. The power of dance and positive energy!! I was diagnosed with chronic Lyme disease and co-infections (after multiple misdiagnoses) I went from being a college level tennis athlete to barely being able to walk up a flight of stairs. While I'm fortunate that medicine and acupuncture helped me, the aftermath of the sickness to my body left me extremely weak and unhappy with my weight. Through body by Simone I was able to restore my strength and confidence all while having a great time doing so! I was able to run a 5k and raise $5000 for the global Lyme alliance -
Something that seemed impossible when I was bedridden and weak. Thank you again for making it a blast to wake up every morning and come "shake it off and sweat it off at your studio!" It truly had been life changing and I'm forever thankful!

SIMONE'S MOVE OF THE WEEK! Lay on your back. Place the pilates ball between your ankles. Squeeze the ball to engage your adductors, lift your head up off the mat as you lower your legs towards the floor. Be sure to scoop your belly bringing your navel to spine. Crunch in bringing your knees to your chest as you kick back out. Repeat and then raise and lower legs to the floor. Build up to 3 sets of 10 reps.

Workout Wednesday! I am using our new custom BBS Pilates ball. This exercise targets the adductors and the obliques. Set up position. Lay on your side making sure you are stacked on top of your hips. Squeeze your top leg towards your bottom as you fire from your adductors. Keeping the contraction raise both legs off the floor as you crunch in your obliques. Pull your knees towards your navel and kick out keeping your feet off the floor.
To keep the strain out of your neck by pushing down into the floor with your forearm. Try 30 reps on each side.

One of the things I ❤️ about Fall is having soup. It warms the soul. Split pea is one of my favorites. I am not the best chef 👩‍🍳 in the world but I like to experiment. This recipe has Simple ingredients:
1 pound dried green split peas
1 small onion, chopped
2 medium carrots, peeled and diced
2 celery stalks, diced
2 tablespoons olive oil
2 bay leaves
1 teaspoon salt
Freshly ground black pepper
6 cups water For more recipes pick up a copy of my book 📖 enjoy 😊

My one and only choice for Dance Cardio has always been Newton Running. Five years later, my dream of a collaboration has finally come true.

SIMONE'S EXERCISE OF THE WEEK!
Lower abs and core work:
Lay on your back, place your hands on the floor to help stabilize. Squeeze the ball to engage your adductors keeping your legs straight and feet flexed. In a clockwise direction make small circles for 5 reps then repeat in the other direction. Keep your belly scooped and navel to spine so your back is flat on the mat.
Then tick tock the legs side to side. Squeeze the ball again legs parallel and straight. Move your legs away from your body and then back to your mid line. Working in your obliques and core. Be sure to keep you opposite hip on the mat. Start with 10 reps and build to 30.

Morning or evening workout? What do you prefer?
My first client is usually at 6am. 😱
I was never a morning person. Dancing on stage 8 times a week and getting home at 11pm for so many years. Meant my routine was back to front. One of my favorite things now about my job is, I get to start the day bright and early before many are even up. The 6am workout literally wakes you up, stimulates your body and mind and boasts your mood. I feel strong and powerful and ready to tackle the day.

Fitness Friday!
Chest squeeze with 5 pound weights. A little twist on the traditional chest squeeze.
Start with arms in a goal post position, firmly hold the weights. Bring your elbows in towards your midline and hold for 3-5 seconds.
Now try with alternating arms. Muscles worked: chest, shoulders, biceps.
If you feel strain in your neck lower your arms and rest for a moment whilst your roll out your shoulders and neck.
Try 8 chest squeeze, followed by 4 alternating arms.

Leg series with our custom CLX @theraband. Main muscles worked: hamstrings, glutes, Core. Set up: place the loop of the band around the sole of your foot. Thread the band through your legs and hold the band down on the floor to control the resistance. Externally rotate and lift the leg off the floor. 8 reps. Flex foot and pulse the leg up and down for 8 reps. Point and flex the foot for 8 reps. Do 3 sets of 8 reps on each side. Be sure to draw your navel to spine, don’t strain in your neck or tilt your hips.

SIMONE'S MOVE OF THE WEEK!
Work on your core strength. Keep your spine flat on the mat. Lift your head up and engage your core. Place the foam roller under your heels. Pull your heels towards your glutes as you contract your hamstrings. Kick legs back out to straighten. Repeat 10 times and lower down. Build up to 3 sets.

Workout Wednesday! The jump squat is one of my favourites on the trampoline and is featured in my latest DVD. This plyometric exercise will target the glute max, hamstrings, quads, calves and core. The benefit of doing this on the trampoline is the soft mat lessens the impact protecting your joints. Also this is a slightly unstable surface so your are really forced to brace and stabilise. Three sets of 10 with a 30 second hold in between. Your heart will be pounding. ❤️ and your legs will be on fire 🔥

If you are like me and just getting back from vacation, then you will also be starting your New Years resolution today. I have had an incredible time travelling and have allowed the wheels to fall off. I ate and drank whatever I wanted. It’s now time to put the wheels back on and feel fit and strong again.
I am starting today with my 14 day cleanse from my book. This means eliminating dairy, gluten, sugar, sodium, alcohol and caffeine. The cleanse gives my body a chance to reset and cleanse and detoxify my system. The first few days are ROUGH, especially coming off the caffeine and sugar, but by day four you actually start to feel amazing. Because your body has no stimulants in it you sleep like a 👶🏼 Your eyes glow, your nails and hair grows and your body and digestive system works as it should. For more information pick up a copy of my book from my website or Amazon.

Tricep Tuesday! One of my favorites from my @bbsstudio Arms Back and Core Class.
I am using my custom BBS @theraband CLX band with 9 loops.
Set up. Stand firmly on the band to secure it and keep the resistance. Place your hand in the loop and bend at your elbow. Drive your palm towards the ceiling hold at the top and then bend at your elbow. Repeat for 32 reps on each side or until muscle fatigue. 💪🏻

Simone shows us Some abdominal work that you can do at home. Lay flat on your back, knees bent. Lift your head and upper body off the mat. Bring one knee towards your chest, place it down and swap to the other leg, then lift both legs. Complete 20 reps. Be sure to keep your spine flat on the mat and your navel towards your spine.

Simone demonstrates one of her favorite plank series. Start in the perfect plank with wrists underneath shoulders, navel pulled up towards your spine and your pelvis tucked under. Drop one knee to the floor followed by the other knee and then lower both knees. Engage your core and feel your lower abs firing. Begin with 3 sets of 10 reps.

Bunny hop 🐰 jump squat with cable row. I like to multi task!
Try this bunny hop into jump squat, pulling the bands back simultaneously. It will not only work the muscles involved in the pulling motion: lats, rear delts, teres minor and biceps but also your lower body in the deep squat: quads, hamstrings glutes, lower back and abs. It secretly kick your cardio ass too 🍑

Please tag me in all your at home transformation. ❤️ wanted to say thank you! I have always been active but once I went through pregnancy and had my little boy I did not know how I was going to be able to exercise again. I saw you on daily pop while Eating lunch and taking care of Conner and immediately googled
you. When I was in school I did dance, cheer, and gymnastics a long long time ago so your workouts seemed like just the thing I needed. With being on maternity leave and having a newborn I have not ordered your workouts yet but uses the free ones on YouTube.
I am hooked! They are fast paced and hard but possible to do so that I can do them more than once and not get bored! This has given me a lot back being able to exercise for my outlet but most importantly get my body back and healthy. I am already down to pre
pregnancy weight and now trying to get in even better shape like I was in college
❤️

Hi beauties,
I often get asked how I keep up my healthy routine when I travel so much. I make it a point ahead of time, to check out the hotel’s in room dining menu. That way you can see if they offer healthy options.
The crazy rain this morning in NYC, kept me away from my studio. So that meant taking meetings in my hotel. This kale salad is one of my favorites, super fresh and healthy. Perfect to have in my room on a day like today. @1hotels 😋
Back at it again. Jet lag is kicking my booty. Wide awake starring at the ceiling so thought I would make the most of it while everyone else sleeps.

My Monday Motivation, all day everyday is working with women.
The beauty of this show is we have access to people who really need the help. And that makes me very emotional, because it’s easy to train a celebrity who gets paid to look like that. But to work with people who you feel like you actually change their lives, is the best gift ever and is truly why I love what I do and why I love this show.
That’s a wrap on season 2 @revengebody

Workout Wednesday! Part 2 in my balance and stability exercises. Stand on a wobble board. Parallel leg kick back with flexed foot. Main Muscles worked: quad, hamstrings, glutes and calves. This exercise is quite challenging and requires focus. Begin with 4 reps on each leg. Try to build up to 8 without placing the foot down. Good luck! @aloyoga @newtonrunning

How do you keep your energy up all day everyday?
I shared two of my tips with @clean.plates
I find setting an intention at the start of the day helps to center me, and set me up for a productive day.

Fitness Friday! Trampoline jumps. Very similar to box jumps but on a more unstable environment. These jumps improve the reaction of your fast twitch muscle fibres so you can generate maximum force. This explosive movement will kick your heart rate up and really assist with burning calories. You will tone your quads, hamstrings and glutes all at the same time. Hey beauties, I am headed to NYC tomorrow, and I am very excited to be co hosting this meditation and fitness event. Check out the details below and go to the link in my bio to sign up.
MNDFL: Meditation + Fitness Event with Ellie Burrows, Ariel Dobshinsky and myself.
Tomorrow Feb 12, 2018 7:00 PM in NYC!
New Yorkers, we go hard. Meditators, we go soft. How can we store lessons learned on the meditation cushion in our "muscle memory" so when we work out we can experience benefits beyond a good sweat? Join MNDFL co-founder Ellie Burrows and myself for a conversation that will delve into self-love and self-compassion as well as how we can be mindful of our limits and check our ego at the door in when we exercise. The evening's meditation will be led by Ariel Dobshinsky, a MNDFL Teacher Training graduate who also happens to be Regional Director at Soul Cycle.

@jensweg one of our 8 week total body makeover winners from LA shares her experience of week 1.
my reflections on the first week are below.

i feel amazing. 7 whole days in the books and i'm astonished at the difference in my energy level, sleep patterns, digestion. i'm already seeing a difference in my body - my clothes are fitting better and my arms and abs feel more toned to the touch. i'm more motivated than i thought i would be at this point, to be honest. i cannot wait to see how i feel at the end of the 8 weeks. i was worried that getting to the studio would be more of a struggle than it was. i'm using this body makeover program as the foundation for my setting new (more realistic and healthy) boundaries at work; setting myself and my team up properly so that i can leave in time to get to class every night. the support and encouragement from the entire BBS LA team has been amazing; i look forward to coming to the studio every day. i also did something i NEVER thought i'd be able to live through yesterday - a double! dance cardio + HTB. dance cardio was my first ever BBS class and until this week i hadn't taken one since. i was terrified to 'step back into the ring.' but wednesday's 7:30p dance cardio came and went (Michelle was amazing, obv!) and i SURVIVED! imagine that. so i doubled it up yesterday and was truly shocked that i was able to last the two hours. that, i think, was the best and most motivating way to round out week 1.
that's all i have for now. THANK YOU for everything you do! XO

Turning your passion into a business is never easy.
-
In fact, it's damn near impossible.
And for the few that succeed, once that passion becomes work it scares most off.
-
Simone De La Rue is the exception.
When a cancelled Broadway show left her a jobless dancer in NYC, Simone could have quit.
-
Instead, she took her passion for dance-based fitness and ran with it.
-
The result was @bodybysimone, which has become synonymous with celebrity bodies in Hollywood.
-
Click the link in my bio to see how Simone's entrepreneurial journey unfolded!

Fitness Friday! Buns of steel! I am using our new custom BBS Pilates ball. Set up in table top position. Main Muscles worked: glutes, hamstring, calves.
Reps: 32 of each exercise on each side.
Hamstring curl. Squeeze the ball as you drive your heel toward your glute and hold the contraction for one second. Release. Repeat.
Holding the hamstring curl drive your heel towards the ceiling and pulse. Repeat.
Externally rotate the knee to the side and hold at the top of your range lower the knee back to parallel. Repeat.
Be sure to keep the hamstring in contraction the entire time and squeeze the ball so it does not escape.

Stretch! It is an Important part of recovery. It's easy to forget to do it and the end of a workout, but make sure you leave a good five minutes to cool down and breath through your deep stretches.

A little flexibility and strength exercise. Plank to standing split.
Works your upper body strength, pecs, deltoid, biceps, core. And then flexibility of your hamstrings and lower back. Start with two sets of 12 reps on each side.

Here are Kats thoughts from week 2 of 'The 8 week total body makeover plan' Hi Alice & Simone,
I can't tell you how much I'm enjoying every single class ! The workouts are so thorough and I love the high energy. Alice, I have to tell you your class was so dynamic, I'm not saying that b/c you are reading this but I was blown away by how engaged you & everyone in the room was with your workout and fun energy !
I have been seeing the change in making sure I always have snacks in my car, almonds raisins etc in case I get stuck in between clients and not making bad decisions. I also find myself going out of the way to a Whole foods when I have been in a jam instead of doing something indulgent so habits are getting better : )
I ordered new shoes and I'm looking forward to getting them since my feet have not been very happy with me but other than that - thank you for such an amazing, fun experience. These workouts are so much fun but I can feel the targeting of the areas that we are working and I am excited to see some changes.
I did second trampoline class today and Bridget was great at giving tips to get the hang of it.

Let me know if you suggest or recommend anything else !
Love Kat

Workout Wednesday! Try this side plank variation with the gliding disc. Set up in side plank. Place disc underneath your toe. Swing you leg forward toward your navel and glide back to your starting position. Main muscles worked: chest, shoulder, oblique, abdominals, glutes. Reps: 2 sets of 8 reps. Modification: come down and balance on your forearm. Disc will be available for sale soon through our website.

Fitness Friday! Part 3 of my leg series with our custom BBS X @theraband CLX band. Set up in table top position with the loop around the sole of your foot. Main muscles worked: hamstring, glute, calves, core. Externally rotate your leg and flex your foot. Raise your leg off the floor firing from your glutes. Drive your knee towards your shoulder and kick back. Repeat for 32 reps on each side.

Workout Wednesday!
Booty time 🍑
Try these simple exercises to tone your hamstrings and glutes.
Three sets of 8 reps of each exercise on each side.
I have added a BBS 2 pound ankle weight to increase the burn.
Take the tempo of this exercise nice and slow. Be sure to keep your knees underneath your hips, draw your navel in towards your spine. Keep your hips square and your leg at hip height. Imagine you are resting a tray of cookies 🍪 on your back and you don’t want them to drop on the floor.
Squeeze and contract your glutes with every pulse, so your glutes learn to fire on their own.
For more lower body workouts, pick up a copy of my Hips Thighs and Buns DVD and digital stream, or come into one of my @bbsstudio and try a Live class.

Sweaty Saturday! Work deep into those lower abdominals. I am using our custom BBS Pilates ball. Place the ball under your lower back and lift your legs up. Place your arms out to the side and push down with your hands to really stabilise. Flex your feet and lower your legs down towards the floor. Work to your own range of motion and be sure to keep your abs scooped under, navel to spine. Raise your legs and repeat.
Double leg bicycle. Bend knees and kick out in front and then raise them. Reverse direction to test your strength and balance. Begin with three sets of 8 reps.

It's National Dance Day! I started dancing at the age of 3 with Miss Vivienne Dunn. I trained under her until I was 18 and landed my first musical CATS as Victoria the white cat. Joanne Robinson was the Director. Both of these woman hugely impacted my life and dance career and I am forever grateful for their love and belief in me. I am now 42 and still dance everyday at BBS. Dance is and always will be my passion, my therapy, my true love. I celebrate today the beauty of dance. Please join me and @sequinjillian @kmulls7 downtown at the Music Center with @dizzyfeetfoundation we are teaching a dance cardio routine and hopefully inspiring others to dance. It's free. We would love to see you there. Happy Dance Day! 💃👯❤️

Got an office chair? Why not use it! Try this advanced move. Step up onto your chair making sure it's sturdy first. Activate your quad, hamstring and glutes as you stabilize yourself. Kick your leg back behind you parallel and extended. Bring it back and step down. Begin with 10 reps on each side.

You know I love a good cause. Check out www.morefoundationgroup.org Zero out your carbon footprint with gently used athletic shoes. One pair of shoes = one ton of Carbon. Sustainable farming reduces atmospheric CO2 for all. Tree farming provides fuel, fiber, perpetual food harvests, jobs and an end to poverty. Economic activity in the village is jump started creating dozens of local profit centres. Basically donate your old loved shoes to support MORE regenerative agriculture for generations to come. I am using a 10lb ball for this Russian twist, feet elevated throughout, at a controlled tempo, not too fast, with a little “Australian twist” 😜 in the middle. Aim for four sets of 20 (10 per side) as a starting point.
This exercise really hits the obliques and helps fight off the love handles.
